item.title: FILE Structure Exploitation
item.description: Introduction The technique known as FILE structure exploitation is a technique which aims to abuse the FILE struct within libc. This structure, as well as it’s associated set of functions, is used as a buffered input and output stream. This allows for more optimized i/o as it performs less read and writes, which allows for less context switching into the kernel. However, if not used correctly, the FILE structure can be abused to gain various exploit primitives.
